DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Calcium Cation Electrolytes Outcome Lower Limit of Normal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the numeric value quantifying the lowest result in the normal range of free calcium, the metabolically-active portion of calcium and is not bound to proteins in the blood, as an electrolyte, substances that break up into ions (electrically charged particles) when they are dissolved in body fluids or water, lab.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Calcium Cation Electrolytes Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the results of a medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for free calcium, the metabolically-active portion of calcium and is not bound to proteins in the blood, as an electrolyte, substances that break up into ions (electrically charged particles) when they are dissolved in body fluids or water.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The metabolically-active portion of calcium, not bound to proteins, circulating in the blood.:(eh-LEK-tro-lites) Substances that break up into ions (electrically charged particles) when they are dissolved in body fluids or water.  Some examples are sodium, potassium, chloride, and calcium.  Electrolytes are primarily responsible for the movement of nutrients into cells and the movement of wastes out of cells.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The metabolically-active portion of calcium, not bound to proteins, circulating in the blood.

Substances that ionize into anions and cations in body fluids.  Electrolytes regulate nerve and muscle function and water distribution between cells, plasma, and interstitial fluid.  Imbalances can cause serious physiologic effects, including seizures, cardiac arrhythmias and convulsions.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Calcium Lab Lower Limit of Normal Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numeric value quantifying the lowest result in the normal range of values for calcium in peripheral blood serum used as a comparative reference for the lab test of a patient.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The bottom of the normal range for a particular laboratory result.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The lowest value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changes for initial use on protocol; minor changes to make ISO 11179 compliant for Release

DataElement.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
